TitleIssue: Maintain the project structure (indentation) after moving todos to Archived  <U+00B7> "
DescriptionIssue:
AS IS: Given a todo structure where you have:
Project 1:
  • Feature 1
    • Todo 1-1
    • Todo 1-2
    • Todo 1-3
When todos nested in the structure are archived they become "flat", like in the image bellow This means that it's hard to keep the proper context of done todos. TO BE: Todos when archived still maintain their structure, by also copying the project name, and parent todo if possible, like in the image bellow: Issues:
  1. What to do in the situations where the parent todo is not marked and done, but the child is?
Perhaps would be nice to tint the parent todo to a slightly faded grey in the "archive" project, to show that it is not yet done, and when it's done show it in full normal color.

TitleIssue: Null values in entity should not be passed to DB - option to ignore them <U+00B7> "
DescriptionIssue:
In a distributed scenario we often get data as use-case-optimized DTOs.
Then we are mapping them onto internal entities. If we use UpdateGraph and the 'internal' entity has null values (which is quite common after mapping from a DTO) the database is updated with null values (or records are even deleted...) We really need an option to consider this scenario.
Issue opening motivation(s): Functional Aspects - Reported a bug####Problem - Persistence issue
Issue closing motivation(s): Change - No time to work on this change

TitleIssue: Reduce solar panel output during rain, fog, different seasons, increase turbine output during storms. <U+00B7> "
DescriptionIssue:
Not only because it makes sense, but because it balances out the other power consumption changes. The numbers I propose are relatively mild:
  • 90% solar power for fog.
  • 60% solar power for thunderstorms.
  • 15% solar power for eclipses. Because they are not a total blackout.
  • 97.5/100/97.5/95% solar power for Spring/Summer/Autumn/Winter.
  • Random fluctuations of +/-3% solar power thorough the day.
  • 133% turbine power for thunderstorms.

TitleIssue: Life support and ElectricCharge generation not modeled for unloaded vessels <U+00B7> "
DescriptionIssue: TacGenericConverter modules are not considered during LifeSupportController::FixedUpdate.  This requires that stations or in-transit vessels be visited routinely and warped in order for resource production to occur.  This is probably due in part to the fact that ElectricCharge generation is not modeled for unloaded vessels; likely because it is difficult or impossible to know if generation will be successful, especially for solar-powered vessels.  I recommend that ElectricCharge generation be estimated based on full exposure for open solar panels with the powerCurve evaluated for the vessel's current position, plus the generation of any ModuleGenerator parts (e.g. stock RTGs).  This would allow the simulation of TacGenericConverter modules for unloaded vessels.
Issue opening motivation(s): Functional Aspects - Reported a bug####Problem - Performance issue
Issue closing motivation(s): Bug - Not a critical bug

TitleIssue: install of TDS pkg did not seem to update new language fallback value <U+00B7> "
DescriptionIssue:
I'm sorry if this is too specific or more of a support issue, but I just want to make sure my deployments are working fully.
A developer changed one of the Sitecore items language fallback values from 1 to 0 in a standard values item. The change was deployed to our local, DEV and PROD environments. I used TDS and sync with sitecore to upload the change locally, and it was correct and in the standard value, the value was now off. But via DEV and PROD where Sitecore Ship is used to install the TDS pkg, the value checkbox is still checked in that same standard values item. I checked the jobs and confirmed that the standard values item was indeed included in the pkg and listed in the install response.
Hedgehog told me to check my installer logs, but I'm not sure if Sitecore Ship offers any other details.
Is anyone aware of any such toggle values like this not installing? Thanks.
Melissa Mussitsch
Issue closing motivation(s): Not a bug -  Unclear/wrong usage of a functionality

I've placed a package on disk and make a POST request to /services/package/install with parameter path = .....Web.Build.20131023135543.update
(This was tested using Postman) I also tried sending a Raw request with this data:
path=....Web.Build.20131023135543.update Both result in a 500 error saying something went horribly, horribly wrong :-)
I tried attaching the Ship solution to the IIS worker process, but for some reason it does not break.
Any ideas on how to figure out what is going wrong are very welcome!

TitleIssue: Loading NetTool spam on main menu <U+00B7> "
DescriptionIssue:
It would seem that PrecisionEngineering has some problems in combination with Traffic Manager in an odd way:
  1. Start the game
  2. Go to the map or asset editor
  3. After loading, go to the main menu again
  4. Now PrecisionEngineering spams the log with: [PrecisionEngineering] Loading NetTool thousands of times
Consequences of this bug, is that the fps drops significantly over time in the main menu when this is happening (perhaps because of all that loading?). Another thing to add, is that when this is happening, and you happen to open a window in the main menu (e.g. new game, tools, content manager, etc.) and try to close that, it throws the following exception without allowing me to close the window: 
NullReferenceExceptionat (wrapper managed-to-native) UnityEngine.Behaviour.get_enabled () <0x00075>at ColossalFramework.UI.UIComponent.get_isEnabled () <0x0001c>at ColossalFramework.UI.UIComponent.Focus () <0x0005a>at ColossalFramework.UI.UIView.PopModal (int) <0x001aa>at ColossalFramework.UI.UIDynamicPanels.Hide (string,int) <0x000f3>at LoadSavePanelBase`1.OnClosed () <0x0006e>at (wrapper dynamic-method) object.DynamicEventWrapper_OnClosed (NewGamePanel,ColossalFramework.UI.UIComponent,ColossalFramework.UI.UIMouseEventParameter) <0x00018>at ColossalFramework.UI.UIComponent.OnClick (ColossalFramework.UI.UIMouseEventParameter) <0x000c8>at ColossalFramework.UI.UIButton.OnClick (ColossalFramework.UI.UIMouseEventParameter) <0x0027f>at ColossalFramework.UI.UIInput/MouseHandler.ProcessInput (ColossalFramework.UI.IInputTranslator,UnityEngine.Ray,ColossalFramework.UI.UIComponent,bool) <0x00bd1>at ColossalFramework.UI.UIInput.ProcessMouseInput () <0x002ba>at ColossalFramework.UI.UIInput.Update () <0x00055>(Filename:  Line: -1)
Trying to close it the second time seems to work though and prevents the exception from happening again. I hope you can replicate the issue. I've nailed it down to Precision Engineering and Traffic Manager. Without Traffic Manager, Precision Engineering works fine.
Issue closing motivation(s): Not a bug

TitleIssue: Deathmatch players sometimes on the same team <U+00B7> "
DescriptionIssue:
On Deathmatch games you sometimes see in the chat "player harmed teamate player.1, so you have sometimes players being on the same team, so they don't get scores and get punished for teamkill, even though in Deathmatch there are no teams.
I could track down the issue, so it seems to happen if a player switches to purgatory in the armory menu, then goes back in the armory menu and choses "automatic" to join the game.
So since in a deathmatch games there are no teams, the function to automatically chose a team seems to have issues with that.
So either fix the automatic function to handle Deathmatch games properly or just deactivate it, since if people join with FIRE button and not through the armory dialog it seems to work fine.
Issue closing motivation(s): Not a bug - Duplicated issue

TitleIssue: I may have found a bug. <U+00B7> "
DescriptionIssue:
In the BaseConverter Convert method, if the number passed in is 06-0E-3C-01-59 then the method falls over on this line. 
result = CharList[value] + result;
with this exception: 
System.IndexOutOfRangeException: Index was outside the bounds of the array.
As the value of "value" is some large negative number.
I have "fixed" the problem by changing the negative number to a positive number in the for loop but I don't know if that is a valid fix. 
else if (newlen > 0)                    {                        if (newlen == nibbles.Count)                            nibbles.Add(0);                        nibbles[newlen++] = 0;                        if (value < 0)                            value = value * -1;                    }
The unit test still pass.
Issue closing motivation(s): Not a bug

So, my projects are stored in /Users/alastair/Code, which is accessible inside the VM as \\psf\Home\Code and Z:\Code. I downloaded OpenWrap and ran the first-time setup, which completed successfully. TitleIssue: Lock contention in AsyncReaderWriterLock.TryIssueLock <U+00B7> "
DescriptionIssue: Opening Roslyn.sln in Visual Studio 2017 (15.3 Preview 6). I observed 11 seconds of lock contention in AsyncReaderWriterLock.TryIssueLock as a contributor to thread pool starvation. This is an asynchronous type being used in asynchronous code; this lock should be removed to aid to the long-term avoidance of thread pool starvation.
Issue opening motivation(s): Functional Aspects - Feature Enhancement####Problem - Performance issue
Issue closing motivation(s): Feature request/enhancement - Feature request/enhancement already implemented or not needed

TitleIssue: New analyser: warn about (delegate).BeginInvoke <U+00B7> "
DescriptionIssue:
I came across the following code when converting our code base to use new threading standards. 
void Main(){    var action = DoWork;    action.BeginInvoke(null, null);}void DoWork(){    ...}
I am not sure what the best thing to suggest is, but my fix was to make DoWork async and switch to a background thread within that. Then call it from a synchronous method using one of the Forget extension methods.
Issue closing motivation(s): Not a bug

TitleIssue: New analyzer: flag calls to `SwitchToMainThreadAsync()` on results of `WithPriority` <U+00B7> "
DescriptionIssue:
See https://github.com/dotnet/project-system/pull/2480/files#diff-94fb0ac9dc91d1c68d18786035b2428eR57 
await ThreadHelper.JoinableTaskFactory  .WithPriority(VsTaskRunContext.UIThreadBackgroundPriority)  .SwitchToMainThreadAsync();
As a general rule, we like to see SwitchToMainThreadAsync() called on a regular JTF instance, and use that JTF instance to call RunAsync (or StartOnIdle as I describe above). That way, any call to SwitchToMainThreadAsync in this code or code it calls will all automatically inherit the priority you specify rather than just this one location.
Issue closing motivation(s): Bug - Not a critical bug

TitleIssue: AsyncQueue does not cache Completion if already finished <U+00B7> "
DescriptionIssue: AsyncQueue.Completion has a fast path for the case where the result is cached. However, if the queue is already completed the first time this property is accessed, the backing field AsyncQueue.completedSource is never assigned. The fast path through this property could be improved by caching the TplExtensions.CompletedTask result so the lock doesn't need to be taken again.
Issue closing motivation(s): Bug - Difficult to fix or to replicate####Bug - It will be fixed in future

TitleIssue: VSTHRD010 should not fire in methods that implement IVs* interface members <U+00B7> "
DescriptionIssue:
It's a given that an IVs*Events interface will (almost certainly) be invoked on the UI thread. So requiring explicitly checking is wasteful, as shown here: 
// IVsSelectionEventspublic int OnCmdUIContextChanged(uint dwCmdUICookie, int fActive){   ThreadHelper.ThrowIfNotOnUIThread(); // VSSDK002 should not demand this before other IVs* calls.   ivssolution.DoSomething();}
Similar argument for overrides of Package.Initialize or Package.Dispose.
Issue closing motivation(s): Not a bug - problem fixed updating the new version of a dependent library/tool

TitleIssue: VSSDK002 should consider control flow when assessing that we're on the UI thread <U+00B7> "
DescriptionIssue:
The following method should trigger an analyzer on the call to SetProperty, but it does not. The analyzer sees the VerifyOnUIThread() "above" the call to SetProperty and considers that it must have executed. 
using System;using Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop;class Test {    void F() {        IVsSolution sln = null;        if (false) {            VerifyOnUIThread();        }        sln.SetProperty(1000, null);    }    void VerifyOnUIThread() {    }}
We should be able to fix this using Roslyn's SemanticModel.AnalyzeControlFlow method.
Issue closing motivation(s): Not a bug

TitleIssue: install of TDS pkg did not seem to update new language fallback value <U+00B7> "
DescriptionIssue:
I'm sorry if this is too specific or more of a support issue, but I just want to make sure my deployments are working fully.
A developer changed one of the Sitecore items language fallback values from 1 to 0 in a standard values item. The change was deployed to our local, DEV and PROD environments. I used TDS and sync with sitecore to upload the change locally, and it was correct and in the standard value, the value was now off. But via DEV and PROD where Sitecore Ship is used to install the TDS pkg, the value checkbox is still checked in that same standard values item. I checked the jobs and confirmed that the standard values item was indeed included in the pkg and listed in the install response.
Hedgehog told me to check my installer logs, but I'm not sure if Sitecore Ship offers any other details.
Is anyone aware of any such toggle values like this not installing? Thanks.
Melissa Mussitsch

TitleIssue: Poor RiakResult content when PBC encounters a "match_found" response. <U+00B7> "
DescriptionIssue: Consider the scenario where you've got multiple writers experiencing an intentional race condition over who can write a RiakObject to the cluster first. The losers will be expected to handle a contingency situation that is the dual opposite of ResultCode.NotFound. Unfortunately there is currently not a ResultCode.MatchFound to act as this opposite. I think it would be a good idea if this was added to the API.  Currently the only way to detect this situation from a RiakResult is with a hack to parse the ErrorMessage property. Example: "Riak returned an error. Code '0'. Message: match_found".  What do you think?
Issue closing motivation(s): Not a bug

TitleIssue: Reduce solar panel output during rain, fog, different seasons, increase turbine output during storms. <U+00B7> "
DescriptionIssue:
Not only because it makes sense, but because it balances out the other power consumption changes. The numbers I propose are relatively mild:
  • 90% solar power for fog.
  • 60% solar power for thunderstorms.
  • 15% solar power for eclipses. Because they are not a total blackout.
  • 97.5/100/97.5/95% solar power for Spring/Summer/Autumn/Winter.
  • Random fluctuations of +/-3% solar power thorough the day.
  • 133% turbine power for thunderstorms.
Issue opening motivation(s): Functional Aspects - Reported a bug####Problem - Performance issue

DescriptionIssue:
As far as I can tell, the library doesn't support root-level link templates, e.g. 
{    "links": {        "posts.comments": {            "href": "/posts/{posts.id}/comments",            "type": "user"        }    },    "posts": [        {            "id": "100",            "name": "Post 1"        }, {            "id": "101",            "name": "Post 2"        }    ]}
Instead, link templates are included in each resource object, and the values are interpolated in, like so: 
{    "posts": [        {            "id": "100",            "name": "Post 1",            "links": {                "comments": {                    "href": "/posts/100/comments"                }            }        }, {            "id": "101",            "name": "Post 2",            "links": {                "comments": {                    "href": "/posts/101/comments"                }            }        }    ]}
While there are probably use-cases for the latter, the former has the potential to save considerable amounts of bandwidth and processing time for large result-sets.
Issue closing motivation(s): Feature request/enhancement - Feature request/enhancement already implemented or not needed

TitleIssue: Error when deleting DocumentTypes referenced by a Nested Content <U+00B7> "
DescriptionIssue:
Steps to reproduce
  • Create a document type A
  • Create another document type B
  • Add a Nested Content property to B
  • Ensure that the Nested Content references document type A in its composition
  • Delete document type A
** Expected Behaviour **
  • The CMS behaves without any error messages.
** Actual Behaviour **
  • An error message is displayed. It informs us that the following call returns a 404:
/umbraco/backoffice/UmbracoApi/Content/GetEmpty?contentTypeAlias=documentTypeA&parentId=-20 Of course the querystring will differ between instances depending on names and ID's.
Issue closing motivation(s): Bug - Difficult to fix or to replicate####Bug - It will be fixed in future

TitleIssue: Issues with Grid Data Type inside of Nested Content  <U+00B7> "
DescriptionIssue:
When using a Grid data type within a Nested Content item, some things don't seem to quite work, in particular collapsing/expanding the item containing the grid. Upon first loading the page and opening the element containing the grid, everything loads up fine. When opening it, you get the following XHR requests:
However if you then collapse the item and then reopen it, all of the styling gets thrown out, you lose the titles telling you what grid data type each item is and the RTEs stop working. Upon moving an RTE, it does re-init TinyMCE, however nothing else is fixed. XHR Request for second open:
From this point on, whenever you try to close the item, it will successfully close and open, but the styling will be broken and everytime you close it the following errors appear in the console: If there's anything more useful I can give you, please let me know. I understand this may not be typical/expected usage of either Nested Content or the Umbraco Grid, however it would be a massive help for achieving a lot of the designs we're building at the moment, while also providing a much clearer, easier editing experience for our clients. Thanks a lot for all your work on Nested Content and the many other Umbraco Plugins of yours we use, and apologies for my useless Friday afternoon brain!
Issue closing motivation(s): Feature request/enhancement - It was fixed as bug

TitleIssue: Use contenttype.resource to fetch doc types <U+00B7> "
DescriptionIssue:
Nested Conent use its own API controller for fetching the available document types.
https://github.com/leekelleher/umbraco-nested-content/blob/develop/src/Our.Umbraco.NestedContent/Web/Controllers/NestedContentApiController.cs but actually contenttype.resource already contains a method to get the content types.
https://github.com/umbraco/Umbraco-CMS/blob/75c2b07ad3a093b5b65b6ebd45697687c062f62a/src/Umbraco.Web.UI.Client/src/common/resources/contenttype.resource.js#L149 it seems this method was added as a part of Umbraco 7.4
umbraco/Umbraco-CMS@d62ae17 Maybe use this method in 7.4+ by checking the server version variable and fallback to the method in ApiController?
For a future release, where Nested Content maybe shouldn't support older version, this part can be removed. It might also be useful if using some of the new directives/components which is a part of 7.4+, e.g. whether to use umb-overlay or dialogService.
Issue closing motivation(s): Feature request/enhancement - It was fixed as bug

TitleIssue: Add some preventative measures to prevent breakages <U+00B7> "
DescriptionIssue: Initially NC was built to store a doc types guid, which was as a means to prevent breakages should someone decide to rename a doc types alias. With the recent change to storing the alias instead, it's now a bit more prone to breakages.  Given we have made sure to prefix the fields that hold the doc type / tab aliases, I wonder if we shouldn't try and add some preventative measures to try and fix things as changes are made, ie, if someone changes the name of a doc type, do a quick search and replace in the database for "ncContentTypeAlias: 'OldAliasName'" and fix the changed entry doing something similar with the tab alias.  This could be done quite easily in the database, but I guess we also need to consider updating the lucene index, as well as the xml content cache.  There is also the question of how far we go, ie, do we also try and detect property alias changes as well?
Issue opening motivation(s): Documentation - Request of adding an example in the documentation
Issue closing motivation(s): Feature request/enhancement - Not relevant request

  • Start Visual Studio and open a solution with a unit test project written for NUnit.
  • Find a unit test and right click on it selecting "run selected unit tests" from the context menu.
  • Unit test is executed.
Expected Results:
  • Nothing extra is added to the project definition.
Actual Results:
  • The following has been added to all nunit projects,
 <ItemGroup>    <Service Include="{82A7F48D-3B50-4B1E-B82E-3ADA8210C358}" />  </ItemGroup>
I need to play nice with others. My use of this tool shouldn't pollute my project files.
Issue closing motivation(s): Bug - Impossible to fix the issue or too expensive change

NUnit Test Adapter (Version 1.0.0.0)

TitleIssue: Code Lens test discovery partially failing for TestCaseSource attributed tests <U+00B7> "
DescriptionIssue:
I'm using the following code (more or less, obviously): 
[Test]public void TestMethod1(){    Assert.That(1+2, Is.EqualTo(3));}[TestCase(1, 2, 3 )][TestCase(4, 5, 9 )]public void TestMethod2(int first, int second, int sum){    Assert.That(first + second, Is.EqualTo(sum));}
In the Test Explorer, three tests are discovered (which is what I'd expect). However, the Code Lens feature in VS 2013 only shows the non-parameterised method as a test. In addition to Code Lens not identifying test source code, methods under test which are tested by a parameterised test method do not detect any tests for themselves (or show only other tests that are not parameterised), which means that tests already written when implementing a method cannot be run directly from that method's source. I'm using VS 2013 Ultimate Update 1, targetting .net 4.5.1 and using NUnit 2.6.3 with Test Adapter 1.0.0.0. Notes:
  1. The same thing happens with tests parameterised using the TestCaseSource attribute.
  2. If some tests (non-parameterised tests) show up for a testable method in Code Lens, selecting "Run All" from here actually runs all the tests, but only results ("x/y passing" & the test list popup) from the detected tests show up in Code Lens.
  3. Changing the name of TestMethod2 to TestMethod1 (i.e. the same as the first one) results in it being identified as a test by Code Lens, but nothing else changes
Issue opening motivation(s): Functional Aspects - Reported a bug####Problem - Testing related issue
Issue closing motivation(s): Not a bug

DescriptionIssue:
I recently updated Umbraco from version 7.4 to 7.6.5. Following that I also updated the UrlTracker to version 3.13.1. I'm not certain but I believe the previous version we had was 3.12. Following these updates, any regex based redirects have been failing with a 404 error generated by the browser (not our site's custom 404 page). The only regex redirects that sometimes succeed have the Force Redirect attribute set to true, though results are still very inconsistent. Unfortunately I didn't test the redirects in the time between updating Umbraco and updating UrlTracker so I can't be sure which update led to the issue. Any help would be much appreciated! Thanks,
Levi

NY

TitleIssue: IIS custom error pages do not work with ANCM <U+00B7> "
DescriptionIssue:
From @Tratcher on June 8, 2016 21:47 The IIS custom error page feature allows IIS to provide/replace the response body for specific status codes. By default it will do this for 401,403,404,405,406,412,500,501,502. However, this does not work with ANCM/Kestrel, all configured error pages are bypassed and the original body from the application is returned to the client. Questions:
  • Do we want to support IIS custom error pages with Asp.Net Core? We have a replacement feature in Diagnostics called StatusCodePages. We also have multiple 500 pages.
  • If yes, should it be opt-in or opt-out? If it were opt out you would be unable to see any of the Asp.Net diagnostics pages by default.
@DamianEdwards @shirhatti @pan-wang @davidfowl Copied from original issue: aspnet/IISIntegration#203
Issue closing motivation(s): Bug - Not a critical bug

TitleIssue: Unable to get information about junction point error <U+00B7> "
DescriptionIssue:
This may be specific to my environment. I run Windows 7 x64 inside a Parallels Desktop on OS X. My Visual Studio projects are stored inside my OS X home directory, which is mapped to the VM by Parallels at the network location \\psf\Home. So, my projects are stored in /Users/alastair/Code, which is accessible inside the VM as \\psf\Home\Code and Z:\Code. I downloaded OpenWrap and ran the first-time setup, which completed successfully. I switched to a project directory, e.g., Z:\Code\MyProject and ran o init-wrap -Git -Projects path\to\project1.csproj;path\to\project2.csproj;path\to\project3.csproj. The following error was displayed:
Unable to get information about junction point
The exception information is as follows: 
System.IO.IOException occurred  Message=Unable to get information about junction point.  Source=OpenFileSystem  StackTrace:       at     OpenFileSystem.IO.FileSystems.Local.Win32.JunctionPoint.ThrowLastWin32Error(String message) in     c:\TeamCity\buildAgent\work\c71e0c1ab1563c43\src\OpenFileSystem\FileSystems\Local\Win32\Interop\JunctionPoint.cs:line 404  InnerException: System.Runtime.InteropServices.COMException       Message=Incorrect function. (Exception from HRESULT: 0x80070001)       ErrorCode=-2147024895       InnerException:
The debug output (obtained by adding the -debug option to the init-wrap command) is as follows:

TitleIssue: Poor RiakResult content when PBC encounters a "match_found" response. <U+00B7> "
DescriptionIssue: Consider the scenario where you've got multiple writers experiencing an intentional race condition over who can write a RiakObject to the cluster first. The losers will be expected to handle a contingency situation that is the dual opposite of ResultCode.NotFound. Unfortunately there is currently not a ResultCode.MatchFound to act as this opposite. I think it would be a good idea if this was added to the API.  Currently the only way to detect this situation from a RiakResult is with a hack to parse the ErrorMessage property. Example: "Riak returned an error. Code '0'. Message: match_found".  What do you think?
Issue closing motivation(s): Not a bug

TitleIssue: Reduce solar panel output during rain, fog, different seasons, increase turbine output during storms. <U+00B7> "
DescriptionIssue:
Not only because it makes sense, but because it balances out the other power consumption changes. The numbers I propose are relatively mild:
  • 90% solar power for fog.
  • 60% solar power for thunderstorms.
  • 15% solar power for eclipses. Because they are not a total blackout.
  • 97.5/100/97.5/95% solar power for Spring/Summer/Autumn/Winter.
  • Random fluctuations of +/-3% solar power thorough the day.
  • 133% turbine power for thunderstorms.
Issue opening motivation(s): Functional Aspects - Reported a bug####Problem - Performance issue
Issue closing motivation(s): Bug - Not a critical bug

TitleIssue: Don't rely on IoC containters to preserve registration order IConfigureOptions services <U+00B7> "
DescriptionIssue: Autofac and possibly other IoC containers will not return IEnumerable resolved services in the order they were registered, but Options currently depends on this behavior. This causes certain extension methods in Kestrel, WebListener, MVC (and EF?) to break when Autofac is used. This will probably require adding an Order property back to IConfigureOptions similar to what we had back in beta7. A key difference is we want to continue running the actions passed to Configure in the order they are added. This will likely require that Configure inspect the IServiceCollection prior to registering the ConfigureOptions instance. This should resolve the issues raised in aspnet/Hosting#785
Issue closing motivation(s): Not a bug

TitleIssue: Standard Rendering Parameters issue in modular project <U+00B7> "
DescriptionIssue:
This is not a bug, maybe would be an enhancement. While working with modular project and Standard Rendering Parameters I have found that Synthesis will generate IStandardRenderingParameters in the first project it finds usage of that template.
By default, the first project is Foundation.Theming one, and this one is referenced by pretty much all features. Now imagine scenario, where you create another Foundation.MyProject. Since M is before T in alphabet, the IStandardRenderingParameters will be created in this project, breaking all models in all Features (because not all features will reference MyProject) I do not know if I explained that correctly :) The improvement here would be to consider Standard Rendering Parameters similarly to StandardTemplate and provide base in Synthesis namespace ?
Issue closing motivation(s): Feature request/enhancement - Feature request/enhancement already implemented or not needed

TitleIssue: Performance - Nested content with RTE <U+00B7> "
DescriptionIssue:
Hi, Thanks for this Umbraco plugin, which is great. I stumbled on an Performance Issue when I was using the plugin for a webproject. Hope you can help me. I was doing the follow:
  • I made an nested content doctype with an textstring field and a RTE field.
  • I made an item that supports the nested content
  • I tried to add items based on the nested content
Problem:
When I added an item in the nested content panel I got an problem with using the RTE-functionalities. Clicking on an button in the RTE results in an overlay window, but it loads very slowly. I takes sometimes over 10 seconds.

In the project that Im working on, the hyperlink functionality is important.
Seems there is a workaround by clicking on the div nested-content__footer-bar, because it causes the select link window overlay renders. It immediately renders and there is no problem at all...
But I wonder, am I the only one with this problem / is this something that can be fixed? Crix
Issue closing motivation(s): Bug - Not a critical bug

TitleIssue: Error when deleting DocumentTypes referenced by a Nested Content <U+00B7> "
DescriptionIssue:
Steps to reproduce
  • Create a document type A
  • Create another document type B
  • Add a Nested Content property to B
  • Ensure that the Nested Content references document type A in its composition
  • Delete document type A
** Expected Behaviour **
  • The CMS behaves without any error messages.
** Actual Behaviour **
  • An error message is displayed. It informs us that the following call returns a 404:
/umbraco/backoffice/UmbracoApi/Content/GetEmpty?contentTypeAlias=documentTypeA&parentId=-20 Of course the querystring will differ between instances depending on names and ID's.
Issue closing motivation(s): Bug - Difficult to fix or to replicate####Bug - It will be fixed in future

TitleIssue: Issues with Grid Data Type inside of Nested Content  <U+00B7> "
DescriptionIssue:
When using a Grid data type within a Nested Content item, some things don't seem to quite work, in particular collapsing/expanding the item containing the grid. Upon first loading the page and opening the element containing the grid, everything loads up fine. When opening it, you get the following XHR requests:
However if you then collapse the item and then reopen it, all of the styling gets thrown out, you lose the titles telling you what grid data type each item is and the RTEs stop working. Upon moving an RTE, it does re-init TinyMCE, however nothing else is fixed. XHR Request for second open:
From this point on, whenever you try to close the item, it will successfully close and open, but the styling will be broken and everytime you close it the following errors appear in the console: If there's anything more useful I can give you, please let me know. I understand this may not be typical/expected usage of either Nested Content or the Umbraco Grid, however it would be a massive help for achieving a lot of the designs we're building at the moment, while also providing a much clearer, easier editing experience for our clients. Thanks a lot for all your work on Nested Content and the many other Umbraco Plugins of yours we use, and apologies for my useless Friday afternoon brain!
Issue closing motivation(s): Feature request/enhancement - It was fixed as bug

The content I am nesting is a nupicker (custom type), see below: http://i.imgur.com/tuXlBSD.png
http://i.imgur.com/LE8eVpG.png

I would expect it to return a single value when maxItems = 1 and in case it's not set a null value. This is causing some trouble with our framework that generates strongly typed models.

TitleIssue: Include all tabs of a doctype <U+00B7> "
DescriptionIssue: This is related to #81, but not exactly the same. Would it be possible (and wise) to implement the option of including all tabs of a selected doc type, instead of choosing one? Something like adding an - all - option to the tab selection dropdown. The reason why I ask this is because in some cases, the same Doc Type can be used in the DTGE (i.e. to provide a "data block" to be rendered with a custom view) and as a Nested Content type. The DTGE does a very nice work putting all the tabs together, and I wonder if it would make sense to have something similar (with or without the tab titles) in Nested Content.

It would be  more useable to change the view to have a list layout instead of the grid, where available types are given more space and we can use more descriptive names to help our content editors.

TitleIssue: Multiple tabs from the same doctype <U+00B7> "
DescriptionIssue:
When adding a doctype to use as a blueprint, you can select doctype1/tab1. You can then add a 2nd blueprint and select doctype1/tab2. This causes doctype1 to show twice in the popup when adding content items, and clicking either icon adds the same fields (e.g tab1)
  • Should you be prevented from selecting multiple tabs off the same doctype?
  • Should multiple tabs be merged when adding content?
  • Or should different tabs be treated as different blueprints, but the labels differ when adding content?
Thoughts?
Issue closing motivation(s): Feature request/enhancement - It was fixed as bug

TitleIssue: Use contenttype.resource to fetch doc types <U+00B7> "
DescriptionIssue:
Nested Conent use its own API controller for fetching the available document types.
https://github.com/leekelleher/umbraco-nested-content/blob/develop/src/Our.Umbraco.NestedContent/Web/Controllers/NestedContentApiController.cs but actually contenttype.resource already contains a method to get the content types.
https://github.com/umbraco/Umbraco-CMS/blob/75c2b07ad3a093b5b65b6ebd45697687c062f62a/src/Umbraco.Web.UI.Client/src/common/resources/contenttype.resource.js#L149 it seems this method was added as a part of Umbraco 7.4
umbraco/Umbraco-CMS@d62ae17 Maybe use this method in 7.4+ by checking the server version variable and fallback to the method in ApiController?
For a future release, where Nested Content maybe shouldn't support older version, this part can be removed. It might also be useful if using some of the new directives/components which is a part of 7.4+, e.g. whether to use umb-overlay or dialogService.
Issue closing motivation(s): Feature request/enhancement - It was fixed as bug

TitleIssue: Add some preventative measures to prevent breakages <U+00B7> "
DescriptionIssue: Initially NC was built to store a doc types guid, which was as a means to prevent breakages should someone decide to rename a doc types alias. With the recent change to storing the alias instead, it's now a bit more prone to breakages.  Given we have made sure to prefix the fields that hold the doc type / tab aliases, I wonder if we shouldn't try and add some preventative measures to try and fix things as changes are made, ie, if someone changes the name of a doc type, do a quick search and replace in the database for "ncContentTypeAlias: 'OldAliasName'" and fix the changed entry doing something similar with the tab alias.  This could be done quite easily in the database, but I guess we also need to consider updating the lucene index, as well as the xml content cache.  There is also the question of how far we go, ie, do we also try and detect property alias changes as well?
Issue opening motivation(s): Documentation - Request of adding an example in the documentation
Issue closing motivation(s): Feature request/enhancement - Not relevant request

TitleIssue: Code Lens test discovery partially failing for TestCaseSource attributed tests <U+00B7> "
DescriptionIssue:
I'm using the following code (more or less, obviously): 
[Test]public void TestMethod1(){    Assert.That(1+2, Is.EqualTo(3));}[TestCase(1, 2, 3 )][TestCase(4, 5, 9 )]public void TestMethod2(int first, int second, int sum){    Assert.That(first + second, Is.EqualTo(sum));}
In the Test Explorer, three tests are discovered (which is what I'd expect). However, the Code Lens feature in VS 2013 only shows the non-parameterised method as a test. In addition to Code Lens not identifying test source code, methods under test which are tested by a parameterised test method do not detect any tests for themselves (or show only other tests that are not parameterised), which means that tests already written when implementing a method cannot be run directly from that method's source. I'm using VS 2013 Ultimate Update 1, targetting .net 4.5.1 and using NUnit 2.6.3 with Test Adapter 1.0.0.0. Notes:
  1. The same thing happens with tests parameterised using the TestCaseSource attribute.
  2. If some tests (non-parameterised tests) show up for a testable method in Code Lens, selecting "Run All" from here actually runs all the tests, but only results ("x/y passing" & the test list popup) from the detected tests show up in Code Lens.
  3. Changing the name of TestMethod2 to TestMethod1 (i.e. the same as the first one) results in it being identified as a test by Code Lens, but nothing else changes

TitleIssue: Loading NetTool spam on main menu <U+00B7> "
DescriptionIssue:
It would seem that PrecisionEngineering has some problems in combination with Traffic Manager in an odd way:
  1. Start the game
  2. Go to the map or asset editor
  3. After loading, go to the main menu again
  4. Now PrecisionEngineering spams the log with: [PrecisionEngineering] Loading NetTool thousands of times
Consequences of this bug, is that the fps drops significantly over time in the main menu when this is happening (perhaps because of all that loading?). Another thing to add, is that when this is happening, and you happen to open a window in the main menu (e.g. new game, tools, content manager, etc.) and try to close that, it throws the following exception without allowing me to close the window: 
NullReferenceExceptionat (wrapper managed-to-native) UnityEngine.Behaviour.get_enabled () <0x00075>at ColossalFramework.UI.UIComponent.get_isEnabled () <0x0001c>at ColossalFramework.UI.UIComponent.Focus () <0x0005a>at ColossalFramework.UI.UIView.PopModal (int) <0x001aa>at ColossalFramework.UI.UIDynamicPanels.Hide (string,int) <0x000f3>at LoadSavePanelBase`1.OnClosed () <0x0006e>at (wrapper dynamic-method) object.DynamicEventWrapper_OnClosed (NewGamePanel,ColossalFramework.UI.UIComponent,ColossalFramework.UI.UIMouseEventParameter) <0x00018>at ColossalFramework.UI.UIComponent.OnClick (ColossalFramework.UI.UIMouseEventParameter) <0x000c8>at ColossalFramework.UI.UIButton.OnClick (ColossalFramework.UI.UIMouseEventParameter) <0x0027f>at ColossalFramework.UI.UIInput/MouseHandler.ProcessInput (ColossalFramework.UI.IInputTranslator,UnityEngine.Ray,ColossalFramework.UI.UIComponent,bool) <0x00bd1>at ColossalFramework.UI.UIInput.ProcessMouseInput () <0x002ba>at ColossalFramework.UI.UIInput.Update () <0x00055>(Filename:  Line: -1)
Trying to close it the second time seems to work though and prevents the exception from happening again. I hope you can replicate the issue. I've nailed it down to Precision Engineering and Traffic Manager. Without Traffic Manager, Precision Engineering works fine.

TitleIssue: Poor RiakResult content when PBC encounters a "match_found" response. <U+00B7> "
DescriptionIssue: Consider the scenario where you've got multiple writers experiencing an intentional race condition over who can write a RiakObject to the cluster first. The losers will be expected to handle a contingency situation that is the dual opposite of ResultCode.NotFound. Unfortunately there is currently not a ResultCode.MatchFound to act as this opposite. I think it would be a good idea if this was added to the API.  Currently the only way to detect this situation from a RiakResult is with a hack to parse the ErrorMessage property. Example: "Riak returned an error. Code '0'. Message: match_found".  What do you think?
Issue closing motivation(s): Not a bug

TitleIssue: Loading NetTool spam on main menu <U+00B7> "
DescriptionIssue:
It would seem that PrecisionEngineering has some problems in combination with Traffic Manager in an odd way:
  1. Start the game
  2. Go to the map or asset editor
  3. After loading, go to the main menu again
  4. Now PrecisionEngineering spams the log with: [PrecisionEngineering] Loading NetTool thousands of times
Consequences of this bug, is that the fps drops significantly over time in the main menu when this is happening (perhaps because of all that loading?). Another thing to add, is that when this is happening, and you happen to open a window in the main menu (e.g. new game, tools, content manager, etc.) and try to close that, it throws the following exception without allowing me to close the window: 
NullReferenceExceptionat (wrapper managed-to-native) UnityEngine.Behaviour.get_enabled () <0x00075>at ColossalFramework.UI.UIComponent.get_isEnabled () <0x0001c>at ColossalFramework.UI.UIComponent.Focus () <0x0005a>at ColossalFramework.UI.UIView.PopModal (int) <0x001aa>at ColossalFramework.UI.UIDynamicPanels.Hide (string,int) <0x000f3>at LoadSavePanelBase`1.OnClosed () <0x0006e>at (wrapper dynamic-method) object.DynamicEventWrapper_OnClosed (NewGamePanel,ColossalFramework.UI.UIComponent,ColossalFramework.UI.UIMouseEventParameter) <0x00018>at ColossalFramework.UI.UIComponent.OnClick (ColossalFramework.UI.UIMouseEventParameter) <0x000c8>at ColossalFramework.UI.UIButton.OnClick (ColossalFramework.UI.UIMouseEventParameter) <0x0027f>at ColossalFramework.UI.UIInput/MouseHandler.ProcessInput (ColossalFramework.UI.IInputTranslator,UnityEngine.Ray,ColossalFramework.UI.UIComponent,bool) <0x00bd1>at ColossalFramework.UI.UIInput.ProcessMouseInput () <0x002ba>at ColossalFramework.UI.UIInput.Update () <0x00055>(Filename:  Line: -1)
Trying to close it the second time seems to work though and prevents the exception from happening again. I hope you can replicate the issue. I've nailed it down to Precision Engineering and Traffic Manager. Without Traffic Manager, Precision Engineering works fine.
Issue closing motivation(s): Not a bug

TitleIssue: OctahedralUVCoordinates and NormalizedOctahedronCoordinates may have "wrong" encoding. <U+00B7> "
DescriptionIssue: This is all conjecture: Originally, I noticed that the tessellated octahedron mesh worked for 1) the octahedron itself and 2) highly tessellated meshes very close to a sphere. In-between values seemed "off", though. If I'm right on this i.e. the morphology of the sphere to octahedron is "wrong" (there's technically infinite options), then octahedron tessellation won't be required (just scaling up to ~2). The goal is to try using this morphology/mapping: https://knarkowicz.wordpress.com/2014/04/16/octahedron-normal-vector-encoding/ This will provide a better distribution of values and ensure that sphere and octahedron values are both functionally identical.
Issue closing motivation(s): Not a bug

TitleIssue: Allow non-links for related links items <U+00B7> "
DescriptionIssue:
Items in the related links section are required to be links. Many of my module's links point to other, related commands in the module. This is similar to PowerShell's own help, where only the names of commands are given in the related links section. For example, here is Get-ChildItem cmdlet's related links section: 
    Online Version: http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=290488    Get-Item     Get-Location     Get-Process     about_Providers

Steps to reproduce

Create a new markdown help file. In the Related Links section add an item that is just the name of a cmdlet: 
    # RELATED LINKS    Use-ACommandName
Run the New-ExternalHelp command to convert the above help to MAML. Note you get this error: 
Exception calling "NodeModelToMamlModel" with "1" argument(s): "254:532 'Use-ACommandName' Expect hyperlink, but got Add-Index"At C:\Program Files\WindowsPowerShell\Modules\platyPS\0.5.0\platyPS.psm1:973 char:9+         $maml = $t.NodeModelToMamlModel($model)+         ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~    + CategoryInfo          : NotSpecified: (:) [], MethodInvocationException    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : HelpSchemaException

Expected behavior

I expect to be able to use just command names for items in the Related Links section.

Actual behavior

I can't use just command names for items in the Related Links section.

Environment data

v0.5.0
Issue closing motivation(s): Not a bug - problem already fixed with the new version

TitleIssue: Multiple related links treated as one <U+00B7> "

TitleIssue: Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.AspNet has been renamed to Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.AspNetCore <U+00B7> "
DescriptionIssue:
The SDK Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.AspNet has been renamed to Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.AspNetCore to align with the naming in ASP.NET Core itself.
This is a breaking change.
The old package supports ASP.NET RC1 whereas the new package is built against the latest release of ASP.NET RC2. Due to breaking changes between ASP.NET RC1 and RC2 the old ApplicationInsights package will no longer be updated and all future updates will be using the new name Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.AspNetCore. We have updated the SDK to use the .NET Core CLI runtime environment which picks the latest set of RC2 dependencies. Please note that this version is not compatible with RC1 bits or the DNX environment. In order to update to the latest ApplicationInsights SDK for ASP.NET please remove any references to the old NuGet package and install the new named package instead (references can be found in the project.json file).
See here for migration steps from ASP.NET RC1 to RC2: https://docs.asp.net/en/latest/migration/rc1-to-rc2.html#namespace-and-package-id-changes
We apologize for the inconvenience of a manual upgrade to a new package name. We chose not to create an automatic migration from the old to new package naming because this could inadvertently break customers still using DNX or other pre-RC2 ASP.NET technologies who are not ready to migrate to .NET Core CLI and ASP.NET RC2.
Issue closing motivation(s): Change - Not relevant change

TitleIssue: Unable to test web site with Microsoft.AspNetCore.App dependency <U+00B7> "
DescriptionIssue:
Found while verifying aspnet/Release#302.

Repro steps

  1. create empty folder e.g. md netCore21RC1Api
  2. cd netCore21RC1Api
  3. dotnet new webapi --name netCore21RC1Api --output . etCore21RC1Api\
  4. dotnet new xunit --name XUnitTest --output .\XUnitTest\
  5. dotnet new sln
  6. dotnet sln add . etCore21RC1Api etCore21RC1Api.csproj
  7. dotnet sln add .\XUnitTest\XUnitTest.csproj
  8. dotnet add .\XUnitTest\XUnitTest.csproj reference . etCore21RC1Api etCore21RC1Api.csproj
  9. dotnet add .\XUnitTest\XUnitTest.csproj package Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Testing -v 2.1.0-rc1-30661
  10. create an xunit.runner.json file in the .\XUnitTest directory containing at least
{  "shadowCopy": false}
  • This setting should be irrelevant for .NET Core 2.1 tests. Including it just in case
  1. dotnet build
  2. Confirm app and test project work fine separately (with project reference but that's it):
    a. cd netCore21RC1Api
    b. dotnet run --no-build
    c. browse to https://localhost:5001/api/values
    d. kill the app
    e. cd ..\XUnitTest\
    f. dotnet test --no-build
  3. Update .\UnitTest1.cs to contain: 
using System;using System.Net;using System.Net.Http;using System.Threading.Tasks;using Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Testing;using netCore21RC1Api;using Xunit;namespace XUnitTest{  public class UnitTest1 : IClassFixture<WebApplicationFactory<Startup>>  {      private readonly WebApplicationFactory<Startup> _factory;      public UnitTest1(WebApplicationFactory<Startup> factory)      {          _factory = factory;      }      [Fact]      public void Test1()      {      }      [Fact]      public async Task Values_Succeeds()      {          // Arrange          var client = _factory.CreateDefaultClient();          // Act          var response = await client.GetAsync("/api/values");          // Assert          Assert.Equal(HttpStatusCode.OK, response.StatusCode);      }  }}
  1. dotnet build
  2. dotnet test --no-build

Expected

A successful run of both tests.

Actual

The XUnitTest.UnitTest1.Values_Succeeds test fails with no error given. XUnitTest.UnitTest1.Test1 still works fine. (Both tests fail if the server is started in the constructor i.e. the CreateDefaultClient() was not placed in a single test.)

Execution in Visual Studio

Visual Studio's Test Explorer window provides more information about the failure:

Details

dotnet --info:

TitleIssue: Add fallback folder to Razor Pages <U+00B7> "
DescriptionIssue:
With the advent of Razor Pages in class libraries, we'd like to allow a way for application authors to "override" certain pages. The convention here is to place any overrideable files under the directory Shared.
  • Routing for files under the fallback directory will use the path relative to the fallback directory e.g. /Pages/Dir1/Shared/Home.cshtml will have the route /Dir1/Home.
  • The file is overridden by a root directory rooted file that has the same path e.g. /Pages/Dir1/Home.cshtml supersedes /Pages/Dir1/Shared/Home.cshtml.
  • Relative path redirects for files inside and outside the fallback directory should just work:
Consider 
/Pages/    /Dir1/        Home.cshtml        _Partial.cshtml        /Shared/            _Partial.cshtml            Home.cshtml            About.cshtml
The following should just work. 
// /Pages/Dir1/Shared/About.cshtmlOnPost() => Redirect("./Home") // Should redirect to /Dir1/Home// /Pages/Dir1/Home.cshtmlOnPost() => Redirect("./About") // Should redirect to /Dir1/Shared/About
Issue closing motivation(s): Feature request/enhancement - Feature request/enhancement already implemented or not needed

TitleIssue: Support RFC 6570 URI templates in IUrlHelper <U+00B7> "
DescriptionIssue:
When trying to generate RFC 6570-compliant URI templates, Url.Action (and cousins) step on my toes quite a bit. Suppose I have a URL-handler like this 
[HttpGet("/some/path/{id}")]public IActionResult GetSomething(string id){...}
When trying to get a route for this using Url.Action, I have to set the id portion of the value object or else no URL will be returned. What I ideally want would be a URL like /some/path/{id} in case the id is missing. Simply setting the value to "{id}" does not work, since the helper URL-encodes the braces, giving me "%7Bid%7D". My current solution is to do a .Replace() on the resulting string, which is cumbersome, to say the least. Is there any better way to go about this?
Issue closing motivation(s): Feature request/enhancement - Feature request/enhancement already implemented or not needed

        [HttpPost("api/stuff")]        [Produces("application/xml")]        public IActionResult Stuff()        {            XDocument xmlDocument = new XDocument(                new XDeclaration("1.0", "UTF-8", "yes"),                new XElement("Response",                    new XElement("Say",                        new XAttribute("voice", "alice"),                        new XAttribute("language", "en-GB"),                        new XText("Hello caller")                    )                )            );            return new ObjectResult(xmlDocument.ToString());        }
The 1.1 version (assembly version 1.1.3.0) returns: 
<Response>    <Say voice="alice" language="en-GB">Hello caller</Say></Response>
The 2.0 version (assembly version 2.0.0.0) returns: 
<string><Response>  <Say voice="alice" language="en-GB">Hello caller</Say></Response></string>
Am I doing something wrong here?
Issue closing motivation(s): Not a bug - configuration/backup problem on the user side

TitleIssue: Use the real type of the model when validating properties using `DataAnnotationsModelValidator` <U+00B7> "
DescriptionIssue:
Given the following models: 
public sealed class AttributeValueModel{    [Required]    public AttributeValueTypeModel Type { get; set; }}public abstract class AttributeValueTypeModel{    [Required]    public string Type { get; set; }    public sealed class TextAttributeValueTypeModel : AttributeValueTypeModel    {        [Required]        public string Value { get; set; }    }}
And a custom model binder that handles binding the following input: 
POST http://localhost:5001/attribute/valuemodel/1548Type.Type: TextType.Value: foo
Such that an instance of AttributeValueTypeModel.TextAttributeValueTypeModel is assigned to the Type property of the model AttributeValueModel, and that instance has it's Type and Value properties set to Text and foo accordingly. To an action: 
public ActionResult(int id, AttributeValueModel model)
When calling ModelState.IsValid from within that action. Then I expect the DataAnnotationsModelValidator will validate using the actual type of the value assigned to ModelValidationContext.Model, causing the result of ModelState.IsValid to be true. The current behaviour causes the result to be False.

What I'm thinking is something like this:

TitleIssue: ImATeapotResult missing <U+00B7> "
DescriptionIssue:
This is serious missing functionality in MVC 6. I'm aware we can do StatusCode(418);, but we need to be able to do return ImATeapot();. Adding this would make the lives of teapot programmers a lot better. On a side note:
  1. We also need a MethodNotFound().
  2. When a corresponding action with the right method is not found in a controller, a 405 should be sent instead of a 404 (See this).
  3. We need the ability to send custom status descriptions (200 OK, 500 I'm fine, 404 Eaten by dog, 404 Abducted by aliens, etc).

TitleIssue: Async APIs on TempData related apis (ITempDataDictionary, ITempDataProvider etc.) <U+00B7> "
DescriptionIssue:
When TempData is used like a dictionary in an action (ex: var foo = TemData["foo"]), we load the temp data in a synchronous way. If the provider is SessionStateTempDataProvider, where Session is stored in a database for example, we would be blocking threads. With support of binding TempData to controller's properties, we could consider adding async apis as the infrastructure could load the data in async way. Presence of at least a single tempdata property would result in trying to load tempdata for all the actions even though some of them might not use it, so we would be increasing the chances of threads being blocked.
Original discussion here: #5872 (comment) @rynowak @DamianEdwards
Issue closing motivation(s): Change - Not relevant change

TitleIssue: ModelState.Exception distinguish between 415 and 422 response code <U+00B7> "

If we use application/json on post methods and validation fails it is very useful to know what kind of reason caused validation to fail. One category of reasons is because input json string might be formatted incorrectly (brackets not closed, for example).
The other category is because, for example, we try to bind string to property defined as int in our mode. Unfortunately, it seems that they both throw same exception (newtonsoft.json.jsonreaderexception) but since i would like to return different status codes for those cases (415 for first and 422 for second) question is: Is there a way to distinguish those 2 categories of error without doing something as ugly as parsing exception message?

TitleIssue: Model binders get incorrect `FieldName` when binding a collection element <U+00B7> "
DescriptionIssue:
modelBindingContext.FieldName has unexpected values in IModelBinder implementations handling collection elements. This issue has no impact in an MVC application with a default configuration because only BodyModelBinder and HeaderModelBinder use FieldName. BodyModelBinder uses FieldName only when binding a top-level value and both binders require unusual customization (e.g. a custom IBindingSourceMetadata attribute on an element type) before they're used for elements. Inside most collections, FieldName is the index and not the actual name e.g. "2" instead of "[2]". Inside a dictionary when the submission used dictionary[name]=value, FieldName is unchanged from the parent scope e.g. "dictionary" instead of "[name]" (or "name" which would at least be consistent with other element binding). Suggest updating the EnterNestedScope() calls in CollectionModelBinder.BindComplexCollectionFromIndexes() and DictionaryModelBinder.BindModelAsync() to correct the fieldName argument values.
Noticed while experimenting for PR #5495 on issue #4362. See https://github.com/dougbu/FieldName for a repro project.
Issue closing motivation(s): Change - Not relevant change

TitleIssue: Request to add a RawTagHelper class <U+00B7> "
DescriptionIssue:
With Razor we can do something like this in MVC:
@Html.Raw("<span>raw markup</span>");
or
@Html.Raw($"<span>{ViewData["Title"]}</span>"); This works great when wanting to add raw markup to a View by accessing some Model data or even inside a Razor @foreach loop. It would be nice to have a RawTagHelper class that would provide similar functionality but for when we want to add raw markup to a view from a static file. The main use case I have for this is to inject the markup in my SVG image files inline into a View (in my case I use it to inject my site's logo.svg file into my _Layout.cshtml file). This allows me to keep the SVG file in the images folder and keeps my _Layout.cshtml from getting too cluttered. It also allows me to remove style declarations from the SVG file itself and apply class names which can then be styled in my site.css file, which gives a huge amount of flexibility. I was able to implement this RawTagHelper myself and it works perfectly using the following syntax:
<raw src="images/logo.svg" /> There is one issue however that I mentioned in Issue #5453. Basically because my TagHelper is not part of the main MVC project the editor tool does not know that my "src" attribute should be handled as local file locations so the context menu to pick from the wwwroot folder does not open up. My implementation of the RawTagHelper is only 30 lines of code and the only thing that would need to be done to add it to the main MVC repo beyond my code would be to update the HTML schema files the .cshtml editor uses and add the <svg> element and the src attribute to it so the editor would know to display the context menu to select a file from the wwwroot folder. Doug suggested that I open this request for your team to triage. Thank you for your time. Bryan Farrell
Issue closing motivation(s): Change - Not relevant change

TitleIssue: Consider specifying attribute capacity of `AttributeDictionary`s and `TagBuilder`s <U+00B7> "
DescriptionIssue:
The KeyValuePair<string, string>[] arrays backing attributes held in AttributeDictionarys are responsible for between 1.6% and 8% of the memory allocated in BasicViews, BigViews and MusicStoreViews scenarios. Unless all AttributeDictionarys contain exactly 4 attributes, a great deal of this memory is wasted. One approach to reduce these allocations would be to add an AttributeDictionary(int capacity) constructor and allocate its backing List<T> there. Since that class is never used directly, would also need a new TagBuilder(string tagName, int attributeCapacity) constructor which uses the new AttributeDictionary(int) constructor. Both constructors would not allocate if the given capacity were 0. Changing consuming code to calculate capacities and use the new constructors will not eliminate the arrays but should save lots of memory.
MusicStoreViews
Exercises AddressAndPayment.cshtml view using loadtest.ps1. View uses lambda-expression-based templating HTML helpers (with built-in templates) in a simple "create" form with ten fields, nine bound to a two-level POCO model.
AttributeDictionary entries
The only use of KeyValuePair<string, string>[] arrays is backing the _items within AttributeDictionary. In this scenario, the arrays are the topmost type used and represent 27.5 MB or about 8% of all memory used.
Issue opening motivation(s): Functional Aspects - Reported a bug####Problem - Performance issue
Issue closing motivation(s): Change - Not relevant change

TitleIssue: FromBody not working as hoped if set on a property of a model (JsonReaderException) <U+00B7> "
DescriptionIssue:
Take a simple case: 
        public class CreateCommand        {            [FromBody]            public string Content { get; set; }        }        [HttpPost("/myurl")]        public void AddNew(CreateCommand command)        {            [...]        }
Send it a post with the body: 
{ "content": "TestContent" }
And see that it errors out with a JsonReaderException.
Message: 
Unexpected character encountered while parsing value: {. Path '', line 1, position 1.
Why is the FromBody, if set on a simple type property, so rudimentary? Why is it not allowed to wrap values in a root object? I would expect it to be good DX (developer experience) for this case to just work. It seems that modelbinding should have plenty to go on once the formatter has returned the deserialized object graph, why not work with that?

TitleIssue: `[BindRequired]` does very little when associated with a simple `struct` property <U+00B7> "
DescriptionIssue:
Noticed while investigating #4630. Adding [BindRequired] to a struct property adds an error message ("A value for the 'SomeProperty' property was not provided.") to ModelState when users leave the field empty. But, Html.ValidationMessageFor() (or similar) almost never shows that error because the SimpleTypeModelBinder adds an error ("The value '' is invalid.") in the same case -- and does that first. E.g. the [BindRequired] error message will only be visible for the following property if the submitted <form> contains no RequiredInt field. 
[BindRequired]public int RequiredInt { get; set; }
Probably need a way for ComplexTypeModelBinder to disable the SimpleTypeModelBinder error case. Or, need to update documentation to make it clear the same error is displayed for an empty struct value whether or not a [BindRequired] attribute is associated. One exception to all of the above is a struct that lacks a conversion from string. SimpleTypeModelBinder won't handle that type. (KeyValuePairModelBinder or a custom model binder might handle it.)

TitleIssue: Limit the set of allowed encodings instead of calling Encoding.GetEncoding() <U+00B7> "

The call to Encoding.GetEncoding() here allows arbitrary encodings: https://github.com/aspnet/Mvc/blob/dev/src/Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Core/Formatters/MediaType.cs#L337 The code in TextInputFormatter should get encodings based on an "allow list" of supported encodings. This will most likely require some new APIs. We might end up adding some new APIs that we use, and then just stop calling the old APIs that don't allow for this restriction.

TitleIssue: Improvements over MapVerb and friends... <U+00B7> "
DescriptionIssue:
They're close to being useful, but I feel like they are still limited in application. What is needed is a way to define a name, the template, the controller and the action without having to resort to the anonymous types every time. Right now in one of my projects, I define a set of extension methods as follows: 
        public static IRouteBuilder Get(            this IRouteBuilder routes,            string path,            string controller,            string action,            string name,            object constraints = null        ) {            return routes.AddVerb("GET", path, controller, action, name, constraints);        }
My AddVerb is similar in intention to MapVerb, except that it uses MapRoute so that I can gain the benefit of route names: 
        private static IRouteBuilder AddVerb(            this IRouteBuilder routes,            string httpMethod,            string path,            string controller,            string action,            string name,            object constraints = null,            object defaults = null        ) {            if(defaults == null)                defaults = new {                    controller,                    action,                };            if(constraints == null)                constraints = new RouteValueDictionary(new {                    httpMethod = new HttpMethodRouteConstraint(httpMethod)                });            return routes.MapRoute(name, path, defaults, constraints);        }
What's missing here compared to MapVerb is:
  • I can still pass a controller and action rather than a RequestDelegate
  • I can still name the route
I'm not sure if this is because the Map* series is an abstraction at the middleware level and MapRoute is an abstraction at the MVC level. But I've campaigned in the past (1, 2) for a better API for route declaration. I think this is still an area where ASP.net Core can improve greatly. High level suggestions would be:
  • Do not rely on conventions
  • Do not force people to use attributes
  • Do not rely on areas to influence application surface area
  • Better documentation ;)
Issue closing motivation(s): Change - Not relevant change

TitleIssue: Remote validation calling server-side Action with inconsistent parameter name <U+00B7> "
DescriptionIssue:
I have domain model that has remote validation on field UrlName: 
public class Page    {        [Key]        [DatabaseGenerated(DatabaseGeneratedOption.Identity)]        public int Id { get; set; }        [Required]        [Remote(action: "ValidateUrlName", controller: "Page")]        public string UrlName { get; set; }        [Required]        public string Title { get; set; }        public string Description { get; set; }        public string Content { get; set; }        [DataType(DataType.Date)]        public DateTime AddedDate { get; set; }    }
View model using domain model (Page class): 
public class PageEditViewModel    {        [Required]        public Page NewPage { get; set; }        public List<int> RelatedPagesIds { get; set; }        public MultiSelectList OtherPages { get; set; }    }
Validation method in PageController (non-relevant methods are omited and only signature of that method is relevant) 
    public class PageController : Controller    {        [AcceptVerbs("Get", "Post")]        public IActionResult ValidateUrlName( string urlName)             => Json(!_pages.IsUrlNameAlreadyExists(urlName) ?                "true" : $"Page with UrlName '{urlName}' already exists");    }
There's a View with it's PageEditViewModel model should remotely validate input of UrlName. 
@model global::Task02.ViewModels.PageEditViewModel    <div class="col-md-10">        <input asp-for="@Model.NewPage.UrlName" class="form-control" />        <span asp-validation-for="@Model.NewPage.UrlName" class="text-danger"></span>    </div>
Problem: for example I'm entering UrlName 2 in input field and it actually sends GET method but instead of
http://localhost:1030/Page/ValidateUrlName?UrlName=UrlName%202
it sends for some reason
http://localhost:1030/Page/ValidateUrlName?NewPage.UrlName=UrlName%202
So Action method can't bind NewPage.UrlName to string urlName parameter of that Action method (as I understand) and string urlName is null. When using other View with Page class as a model of course it makes this GET call
http://localhost:1030/Page/ValidateUrlName?UrlName=UrlName%202 and parameter binds and Action method actually validating. Is there any reason for that behaviour? It's UrlName that is marked with [Remote] atribute, so why add names of every Model properties that contain UrlName property inside to GET request query? I mean, I can parse it from HttpContext.Request.QueryString but it feels not right obviously.
Issue closing motivation(s): Change - Not relevant change

For instances when a user does not have a custom encoder having the ToString method return a defaultly encoded Url would be consistent/nice.

TitleIssue: `DefaultValueAttribute` Should be Applied Before Binding for Action Parameters <U+00B7> "
DescriptionIssue: In #2414 support for DefaultValueAttribute on Action Parameters was added. It is done right before executing the Action, after Model Binding. I think it should be done before/during Model Binding. My reasoning is that since DefaultValueAttribute can only take simple types a developer might need the value to go through binging to be valid type for the parameter. For example I have a parameter of type Microsoft.Net.Http.Headers.MediaTypeHeaderValue. In the DefaultValueAttribute I use the string representation of the MIME type. I need that string to go through binding to become a MediaTypeHeaderValue. Currently I've solved this issue by adding a IValueProviderFactory that exposes DefaultValueAttributes. While I'm fine with this solution I think I might not be the only one with this problem.
Issue closing motivation(s): Change - Not relevant change

TitleIssue: Question: Should non-`ValueType` action parameters _always_ be non-`null`? <U+00B7> "
DescriptionIssue:
objects are created for unbound POCO parameters only when using ComplexTypeModelBinder. This leads to the following inconsistent behaviours:
  • [FromBody] parameters are left null when the incoming request has an empty body. See #4750 for example.
  • POCO types with a string converter (i.e. SimpleTypeModelBinder handles them) are left null when the form contains no corresponding data.
  • IFormFile parameters are left null when no matching files are submitted.
Empty collections are created in most unbound and IsTopLevelObject cases due to activation code in CollectionModelBinder, HeaderModelBinder et cetera. But byte[] arrays are often left null e.g. when the corresponding <input/> was left blank. The question is whether we should address these inconsistencies in 1.1.0. Should certainly check how earlier Web API and MVC releases handle the above cases. But might decide these inconsistencies are warts regardless. Or could split the scearios into "API" and "view" groups, then make separate decisions for each.
Issue closing motivation(s): Change - Not relevant change

The examples I have been able to find in the ASP.NET Core samples are to do with multipart HTTP requests when uploading files. In my case, I want to download files. StackOverflow Question

TitleIssue: Discussion: device detection mechanism <U+00B7> "
DescriptionIssue:
I was unable to found any built-in mechanism that allow developer to build adaptive web site (css media queries not count).
It would be really nice to have some mechanism that allow me as a developer to introduce some mobile or tablet specific layout, views and behaiviors. For some developers this feature is critical. Adaptive web site should adjust his behaivior according to current device. Adaptive site should also have preference mechanism, with ability to switch between preferences, not matter for device (like github for example).
This could help a lot of developers to build rich and adaptive websites. I propose to add such mechanism as separate nuget package with Mvc bundle. API could be something like this:
Firstly we need to include Mvc.Mobile or simillar package.
Than we should register required service and specify some options:
You could just add device detector: 
services.AddDeviceDetector();
After this configuration new ViewLocationExpanders will be applied and start to search device specific views from prefixes or subfolders. Device would be detected from user agent according to lite device detection mechanism (simillar to http://projects.spring.io/spring-mobile/). You could also add preference switcher mechanism, to enable switch: 
services.AddDeviceSwitcher<UrlSwitcher>(switcherOptions => { }, deviceOptions => { });
If you specify device switcher, you should also map this switcher to some route: 
route.MapDeviceSwitcher();
After that, you will have an ability to override default agent detetection with some preference, by calling URL in format: /choose/{device}.
Mechanism should provide following extensibility point:
  1. Allow developer to change device codes, and aliases
  2. Allow developer to use own device implementation, by adding specific device factory
  3. Allow developer to introduce new device types expect regular table and mobile
  4. Allow developer to switch between Switcher mechanism (by default, it should store preference in cookies, but also should be have ability to use URL switcher)
  5. Allow developer to change URL generation rules
Implementation for such mechanism would not require a lot of effort, and not break anything (since it could placed completely separate). Any thought on this one?
Issue closing motivation(s): Change - Not relevant change

Potential fix

So, I'd like to propose to move the class to another, more generic (not under TagHelpers and Internal) parts of the namespace.

TitleIssue: Calling conventions for ViewComponents <U+00B7> "
DescriptionIssue:
Invoking ViewComponents currently feels a little messy, mostly for two reasons:
  1. The name of the component is a magic string with no compile-time binding.
  2. The parameters are passed in via an anonymous object with no intellisense available.
The current documented method as of RC2 (and please advise if I'm wrong here) appears to be: @await Component.InvokeAsync("UserTable", new { users = Model.Users }) With a little bit of work and the new nameof expression we can get around point 1, but it's a little awkward as nameof returns the full class name. In the example above, the likelihood is that if following convention your class will be named UserTableViewComponent and the following will throw an error: @await Component.InvokeAsync(nameof(UserTableViewComponent), new { users = Model.Users }) If we rename our class and manually derive from ViewComponent or decorate with attributes we have a working solution (at the cost of breaking convention): @await Component.InvokeAsync(nameof(UserTable), new { users = Model.Users }) Would it be possible for the InvokeAsync() method to be aware of convention based usage of nameof and automatically detect and remove ViewComponent from the end of the component name, when specified? I have seen the generically typed version of InvokeAsync(), but unfortunately razor really doesn't play well with generics in method calls, parsing the < and > as HTML tags, leaving you with additional parenthesis: @(await Component.InvokeAsync<UserTableViewComponent>(new { users = Model.Users })) This final one seems to probably be the best way to adhere to conventions and not rely on magic strings, yet in every piece of documentation and tutorial I've seen it's plain old InvokeAsync() that's used. Is there a reason why? Regarding the parameter passing, and taking into the account the above, having used and written TagHelpers in .NET Core (which are absolutely fantastic, by the way!) I can't help feel that the same kind of approach, with parameters automatically converted into kebab-case attributes, would be so much more pleasant to use and interact with in your views. Following the example above, the ideal would seem to be to be able to do something like: <user-table users="Model.Users" /> If Visual Studio integration and Intellisense could work as well on the above as it did on TagHelpers it'd seem to be a pretty big win for usability and readability in razor views. Thanks, and as a PS, I think you're all doing great work with .NET Core.
Issue closing motivation(s): Change - Not relevant change

TitleIssue: Add default asp-fallback-test for the script TagHelper <U+00B7> "
DescriptionIssue:
I think there should be a default asp-fallback-test which is used if a specific one isn't already provided. It should be possible to use a DOM event like scriptElement.onload to determine whether or not the script was successfully loaded. This might not catch quite everything a custom test would like if an empty 200 response was returned instead of the expected script, but I suspect this would catch the vast majority of script load failures. Here is an example test the @glennc added to http://packagesearch.azurewebsites.net/. A complicated fallback test could probably be omitted if a default was provided. 
<script src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/angularjs/1.5.5/angular-route.js"        asp-fallback-src="~/lib/angular-route/angular-route.min.js"        asp-fallback-test="(function() { try { window.angular.module('ngRoute'); return true; } catch(e) { return false; } })()"></script>

TitleIssue: Filters provided by an `IFilterFactory` cannot usefully implement `IOrderedFilter` <U+00B7> "
DescriptionIssue: The DefaultFilterProvider does not change the FilterProviderContext.Results order when it encounters IFilterFactory implementations. The order therefore matches that of the ActionDescriptor.FilterDescriptors, which ControllerActionDescriptorBuilder sets based on the IFilterFactory's Order and Scope. Suggest DefaultFilterProvider should reorder the Results when a created filter implements IOrderedFilter. If not, should expand the documentation of IOrderedFilter to cover cases where the Order is not honoured.

TitleIssue: ModelBinding does not like setter only properties <U+00B7> "
DescriptionIssue:
Hi Guys, It's me again, trying to do things with modelbinding that I thought should be possible but are not.
This time it's trying to modelbind to an object like this that has shadowed properties. 
public class Query: BaseQuery {   [CsvConverter]   public new ICollection<string, string> Status {set { base.Status = value; }}   public new string AnotherProp {set { base.AnotherProp = value; }}}
This should work just fine but modelbinding decides that any shadowed property is no longer a property of the model and it completely disappears in the ModelMetadata.Properties. Why have I created it like this? Separation of concerns, I have a few Query objects in another project with handlers that get called via MediatR and I do not want to decorate these with attributes for MVC concerns, I also don't want to make everything virtual for the sake of "maybe I need to override these in another project". EDIT: Just tried this with virtual properties as I want to continue in the meantime, exactly the same problem. That shadows don't work alright, but no virtuals is kind of shocking.
